burtis.modules.sync

Class WatchdogService

  • java.lang.Object
    • burtis.modules.sync.WatchdogService

  • class WatchdogService
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements thread controlling liveness of modules. In case of some going out of sync, the simulation will be either terminated (if module was critical) or left running.

    The check is performed if either happens:
    • acceptTick() is called after scheduled period was reached;
    • scheduled period was reached again and no acceptTick() call was done in between.
    Author:
    Amadeusz Sadowski

    • Method Detail

      • acceptTick

        public void acceptTick()
        If check was scheduled, it's executed.

      • handleModuleResponded

        public void handleModuleResponded(java.lang.String moduleName,
                                  boolean isSynced)
        Find's appropriate WatchedModule and calls it's WatchedModule.setStateReady(), or if it's out of sync, handleModuleOutOfSync(WatchedModule) is called.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - - module name to be found and handled.
        isSynced - - informs whether the module responded in sync with current iteration (true if response was in sync).

      • startWatching

        public void startWatching()

      • stopWatching

        public void stopWatching()

      • check

        private void check()
        Checks state of every module.

      • findByName

        private WatchedModule findByName(java.lang.String moduleName)

      • handleModuleOutOfSync

        private void handleModuleOutOfSync(WatchedModule module)
        Calls shutdownAction if module is critical. In other case, module's WatchedModule.setIgnoredTrue() is called.
        Parameters:
        module - - it's state is checked.

      • scheduledCheck

        private void scheduledCheck()
        Schedules next check. If a check was already scheduled, it's called directly.
